parsed.internal_thinking: After analyzing the board, I've identified several high-yield clusters. AI_1 has taken a strong position on the 6-Brick and 8-Sheep (Node 20). My priority is to secure a high-production spot that balances expansion and city-building potential. Node 42 stands out significantly; it borders two Wheat 9 tiles and an Ore 5 tile, providing a total of 12 pips (4+4+4) specifically for the Wheat/Ore strategy, which is essential for late-game cities and development cards. Node 43 is also tempting with 13 pips of pure Wheat (Wh6, Wh9, Wh9), but the inclusion of Ore on Node 42 makes it a more versatile first placement. Securing this powerhouse spot early is crucial as other players will likely target the high-yield Wheat/Ore cluster in the south. I'll aim for a Wood/Brick source with my second settlement to ensure I can actually build roads and expand. [Response was too brief]
parsed.note_to_self: I've secured a massive Wheat/Ore engine at Node 42. For my second settlement, I must prioritize Wood and Brick (ideally the Wood 11 or Brick 10) to ensure I don't get stuck without expansion resources. Watch out for AI_1 or AI_3 trying to cut off my path to the coast or the nearby Wheat port at Node 2.
parsed.say_outloud: That's a solid start, AI_1. I think I'll settle down in the southern fields; those Wheat tiles look like they'll be very productive this season!
